content.rendered:
Photo by Unsplash

We’ve got another big week in the Genesis community brought to you by our guest editor, Tony Eppright of AlphaBlossom. Lots of fireworks this week, including…

  • A very important StudioPress announcement for plugin developers
  • Lots of new themes, including a FREE new Genesis Starter Theme
  • a new podcast with the one and only, Brian Gardner
  • Some very cool new websites and Genesis tutorials
  • and a FREE new plugin for adding content blocks to your Genesis website

Let’s get to it.

Genesis 2.2.7 and important news for plugin developers

Nathan Rice reveals Genesis 2.2.7 will be released on 7 March, and an important announcement for plugin developers.

If you’re a #GenesisWP plugin developer and use the Genesis term meta in your plugin(s), please read this!https://t.co/gz7PkKD4Gr

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) March 2, 2016

UPDATE: The 2.2.7 update will not include the ‘breaking’ change on term meta, that has now been pushed back to Genesis 2.3.0.

I’ve updated the announcement post for the upcoming changes in #GenesisWP … please take a look  ??https://t.co/gz7PkKD4Gr

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) March 4, 2016

Themes

Stephanie Hellwig with a gorgeous new theme called Boho Beauty.

Here she is! In all her glory! Don't be deceived by her #simplicity , you will be surprised what she can do! Bo… pic.twitter.com/o9Fa3d9I7G

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) March 3, 2016

Wes Stratham over at Appfinite releases Follow Me 2.0

It’s here! Follow Me 2.0 is now available for the Genesis Framework – https://t.co/4i2mLtBiIi#genesiswp #WordPress

— appfinite (@appfinite) February 26, 2016

…and is already teasing his next theme.

New #genesiswp theme coming soon!

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) March 3, 2016

Imagely with a new series of themes.

Happy to announce pre @RFWPPI that our new #WordPress themes are available! https://t.co/ZO345m6o3B #GenesisWP

— Imagely (@imagely) February 26, 2016

…and if you’re at PressNomics you can say hi and get demos too!

If you’re at @PressNomics looks for @ErickDanzer in an Imagely t-shirt. Ask him for demos of our new #GenesisWP themes! 🙂

— Imagely (@imagely) March 3, 2016

Calvin Koepke releases his awesome new Genesis Starter Theme. It’s awesome at any price, but for FREE it’s unbelievable!

Download Starter — a simple, lightweight starter theme for the Genesis Framework: https://t.co/PiLg5wEf04 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/04b8EXajN8

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) March 1, 2016

Showcase

Alex Miranda with new and improved website, marknetgroup.com

We just launched our new and improved website https://t.co/2AEHTlmfx6 #WordPress #genesiswp #CustomTheme

— Alex Miranda (@mralexmiranda) February 26, 2016

Kevin Whelan launches new site spirerealty.ca

Launched a new site today using a customized Atmosphere Pro theme by @studiopress #GenesisWP https://t.co/KO0IGX6o8D pic.twitter.com/At3tiNYwSO

— KEVIN WHELAN (@kvnwdigital) February 29, 2016

And finally, the awesome Mike Hemberger with an equally awesome new site for carrierclinic.org

Officially launched a huge non-WP to #genesiswp conversion. My biggest site build to date. https://t.co/abtM0jgerT

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) March 4, 2016

Podcasts

Brian Gardner chats with Nathan B. Weller on Divi Nation (h/t Davinder).

Podcast of 2 successful #wordpress people @NathanBWeller of @elegantthemes & @bgardner of @studiopress https://t.co/A6Gh9CWn7N #genesiswp

— Davinder Singh (@idavinder) February 29, 2016

…and Genesis gets a mention on the latest episode of WPwatercooler (h/t Sridhar).

Some #GenesisWP discussion in here: https://t.co/X3Vr5n6t2e

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) March 1, 2016

…and two awesome members of the Genesis community Rebecca Gill and host Carrie Dils rock the mic on OfficeHours.fm this week to talk how to present yourself and your business.

I’m live with @rebeccagill from #pressnomics. We’re talking about your personal brand!https://t.co/u06FMtTcJV

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) March 3, 2016

Best of the rest

Juan Rangel with tutorial on Building a Full Width Page Template

Genesis Quick Tips – Building a Full Width Page Template #genesiswp https://t.co/UJXrkkTpeP

— Juan Rangel (@WPZombies) February 27, 2016

Sridhar Katakam with another stack of tutorials, and one major tutorial request from me…@Sridhar, I’d like to see a tutorial on how to clone yourself so that you can write so many great tutorials:

  • How to truncate alt text for featured images on content archives in Genesis
  • How to display Social Warfare sharing buttons when content limit is set in Genesis
  • Combining multiple queries in a single loop using array_merge in WordPress
  • How to set height of an element to Viewport height using jQuery in WordPress
  • Using Flexbox for equal height columns in Digital Pro
  • How to change featured image location conditionally in Genesis based on Page’s layout
  • How to show breadcrumbs only on full width content pages in Genesis

How to truncate alt text for featured images on content archives in Genesis: https://t.co/dfhfSHwmhc #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/K4scJrLxav

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 28, 2016

Thanks to Nick Diego for releasing his Content Block builder (light version) for FREE, made for use with Genesis:

I haven’t had the chance to test it out yet, but after watching the video it looks like a great plugin that offers a lot of flexibility in adding content throughout your website.

David Browne with tutorial on How to Add a Hidden Call to Action in Genesis

Back to writing #genesiswp tutorials 🙂 How to Add a Hidden Call to Action in Genesis https://t.co/4J3ZuHueLp

— Dave Browne (@yivva) February 29, 2016

Nick Wilmot is looking for a Genesis auto-complete plugin for Coda, if anyone knows of one.

Anyone know of a #genesiswp auto-complete plugin got Coda – like https://t.co/S7K1bXjqNq (@panic ?)

— Nick Wilmot (@nickwilmot) March 2, 2016

And finally…

Check out this great new plugin – Scriptless Social Sharing – by Robin Cornett.

I wrote a little, lightweight plugin for social sharing buttons: https://t.co/TQMp5DmoEP

— Robin Cornett (@robincornett) March 1, 2016

That’s it for this week! Lots of great content to keep you busy through the weekend. Thanks to everyone for your contributions…let’s keep ’em coming and continue to grow the Genesis community!

PS Did you know GenesisWP.guide is now on Facebook? You didn’t! Check us out.

PPS Did we miss your cool thing? Give it a shout out in the comments below.

excerpt.rendered: Genesis 2.2.7 release date (and an important announcement for plugin developers), new themes, and a podcast with Brian Gardner.
